movies.title: Das Adlon. Eine Familiensaga
movies.plot: About the family who established the Adlon Hotel in Berlin.
movies.simplePlot: About the family who established the Adlon Hotel in Berlin.

biography.bio: Josefine Preuß was born on January 13, 1986 in Zehdenick, Brandenburg, Germany. She is an actress, known for Family Mix (2006), Türkisch für Anfänger (2012) and Rouge rubis (2013).
biography.name: Josefine Preuß

biography.bio: Heino Ferch was born on August 18, 1963 in Bremerhaven, Bremen, Germany. He is an actor, known for Downfall (2004), Run Lola Run (1998) and Le tunnel (2001). He has been married to Marie-Jeanette Steinle since August 10, 2005. They have two children.
biography.name: Heino Ferch

biography.bio: Marie Bäumer was born on May 7, 1969 in Düsseldorf, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany as Henrike Bäumer. She is an actress, known for Qui peut sauver le Far West? (2001), The Counterfeiters (2007) and Jailbirds (1996).
biography.name: Marie Bäumer

biography.bio: Wotan Wilke Möhring was born on May 23, 1967 in Detmold, Germany. He is an actor, known for The Experiment (2001), Who Am I (2014) and Pandorum (2009).
biography.name: Wotan Wilke Möhring

biography.bio: Rosemarie Fendel was born on April 25, 1927 in Koblenz-Metternich, Germany. She was an actress and writer, known for Der Nachtkurier meldet... (1964), Trotta (1971) and Ödipussi (1988). She was married to Hans von Borsody and Johannes Schaaf. She died on March 13, 2013 in Frankfurt am Main, Hesse, Germany.
biography.name: Rosemarie Fendel

biography.bio: Katharina Wackernagel was born on October 15, 1978 in Freiburg, Baden-Württemberg, West Germany. She is an actress and producer, known for Tanja (1997), The Baader Meinhof Complex (2008) and Le miracle de Berne (2003).
biography.name: Katharina Wackernagel

biography.bio: Amy Mußul is an actress, known for Sense8 (2015), Das Adlon. Eine Familiensaga (2013) and Tough Enough (2006).
biography.name: Amy Mußul

biography.bio: Ken Duken was born on the 17th of April 1979 as a son of an actress and a doctor in Heidelberg / Germany. He started to learn acting from his stage actress mother Christina Loeb. Later he took courses by James Reynolds and Bruce McDonald but he never attended drama school. Before starting his career on television in 1997 Ken acted throughout different stage plays, for example "Visit from an old Lady". In the year 1998 he got a hold of his first leading role in the film "Land of Milk and Honey" (direction: Friedemann Fromm), and played side by side with Franka Potente and Heiner Lauterbach. BILD, largest daily paper in Germany, called him a "Shootingstar" with great talent and charisma. In 2000 Ken convinced in the role of Mark, a young guy confined to a wheelchair, in the motion picture "Gran Paradiso" from Miguel Alexandre. This film was nominated for the German Film Award. After some German productions, for example "Nightshift" (ZDF, direction: Lars Becker), Ken took part in the comedy "100 per cent" from Simon Verhoeven. Throughout the last years Ken Duken above all was shooting abroad together with great actors like Peter O'Toole, Klaus Maria Brandauer, Max von Sydow and Dominique Pinon. With the Italian production "Hidden Children" (2003, direction: Leone Pompucci) he gained great success and won amongst others the French Movie-Award at the 18th "Reincontres de Television de Reims". In 2003 Ken and some friends founded the film production company "Grand Hotel Pictures". The successful debut's name was "From another Point of View" (direction and production), which premiered on the 15th of April 2004 in Munich, starring his wife Marisa Leonie Bach and Dominique Pinon, famous French actor (Alien4, Amélie...). At the same time he put on Music-Videos (e.g. Curse - "Gangster-Rap", Oomph - "Das letzte Streichholz") and began to write the script for his first own film "Waiting for Eve". In 2005 Ken played the leading role in the movie "Another league" (produced by Wüste Film, winner of the Berlinale 2004 with "Against the wall") for which he was assigned as best actor at the Comedy-Festival in Monte Carlo. Furthermore he took part at the big Italian production "Karol" (film version of the life of the deceased Pope John Paul II (Karol Woytila)) for Channel 5 (Italy) which achieved an audience rating of 47%. In Poland this film beat all records and was more successful than "Star Wars 3" or "War of the worlds". In March 2005 Ken Duken was awarded with the Grimme Award for his role in "Kiss and Run" before he started filming "Störtebeker" (a movie about the life of the most famous German pirate) in May 2005. Afterwards he played the character Teddy Schrader in Lars Becker's "Nightshift". In summer 2006 Ken played the role of Anatol Kuragin in the international production "War & Peace", based on the novel of Tolstoj, directed by Robert Dornhelm, where he had to shoot in Vilnius/Lithuania and St. Petersburg and afterward he was shooting another international production in Morocco - "Ali Baba", directed by Pierre Aknine. After leading roles in the movies "Distanz" and "Gellert", which were produced by Grand Hotel Pictures, he took part in the Italian production "Il Commissario de Luca", directed by Antonio Frazzi and played Ben Winter, a war returnee from Afganistan in the tv movie "Willkommen zuhause". In 2008 Ken won his second Grimme Award for "Eine andere Liga" and the Franz Hofer Award. In the same year he played the name part in the fairy tale "Koenig Drosselbart", co-starred with Gary Dourdan in the international production "Fire", played the leading role in "Das Unglueck von Ueberlingen" (directed by Till Endemann), a tv movie about the air plane crash in Ueberlingen in 2002, and took part in Quentin Tarantino's "Inglorious Basterds". In 2009 he won the "Bayerischen Fernsehpreis" for "Willkommen zuhause" in the category "best actor TV-movie". At the moment he co-stars with Till Schweiger in his new movie "Zweiohrkueken.
biography.name: Ken Duken

biography.bio: Johann von Bülow was born on September 26, 1972 in Munich, Germany. He is an actor, known for Le labyrinthe du silence (2014), 13 Minutes (2015) and Frantz (2016).
biography.name: Johann von Bülow

biography.bio: Actress Sunnyi Melles was born in Luxembourg as Judith Szunnyi Melles to the actress Judith Melles-Rohonczy (+ 2001) and conductor Károly (Carl) Melles (+2004) not as a princess. She was not born a princess but she later (1993) has married the German prince Peter Prinz Sayn-Wittgenstein-Sayn and thus became a real princess.
biography.name: Sunnyi Melles

biography.bio: Jürgen Vogel was born on April 29, 1968 in Hamburg, West Germany as Jürgen Peter Vogel. He is an actor and producer, known for The Wave (2008), Le libre arbitre (2006) and Life is All You Get (1997).
biography.name: Jürgen Vogel

biography.bio: Burghart Klaußner was born on September 13, 1949 in Berlin, Germany. He is an actor, known for Good Bye Lenin! (2003), The White Ribbon (2009) and The Edukators (2004). He is married to Jenny. They have two children.
biography.name: Burghart Klaußner

biography.bio: Thelma Buabeng was born on March 31, 1981 in Ghana. She is an actress, known for Heil (2015), Break (2009) and bestefreunde (2014).
biography.name: Thelma Buabeng

biography.bio: Christiane Paul was born on March 8, 1974 in Berlin, Germany. She is an actress, known for The Wave (2008), In July (2000) and Life is All You Get (1997). She was previously married to Wolfgang Schwenk.
biography.name: Christiane Paul

biography.bio: Anja Kling was born on March 22, 1970 in Potsdam, German Democratic Republic. She is an actress and writer, known for Space Movie: La menace fantoche (2004), The Final Days (2008) and Wo ist Fred? (2006).
biography.name: Anja Kling

biography.birthName: Nora Marie-Theres Beatrice Elisabeth Freiin von Waldstätten
biography.bio: Nora began acting in television and film while she was a student at the Berlin Arts University, where she graduated in 2007. She won the Bunte Magazine "New Faces" award for best young German actress in 2009, and received the Max Ophüls Prize for "Most Promising Actress" in January 2010. Nora is a descendant of the famous Martha Elizabeth, Baroness Von Waldstätten, who was Mozart's patroness and protector. The Baroness facilitated Mozart's wedding to his beloved Constanza over his father Leopold's objections, and later became a character in the Austrian musical "Mozart" by Michael Kunze.
biography.name: Nora von Waldstätten

biography.bio: Tom Schilling was born on February 10, 1982 in Berlin, Germany. He is an actor, known for Who Am I (2014), A Coffee in Berlin (2012) and Before the Fall (2004).
biography.name: Tom Schilling

biography.bio: Evamaria Salcher was born on March 21, 1975. She is an actress, known for Da wo wir zu Hause sind (2009), Da wo die Berge sind (2000) and Da wo das Glück beginnt (2006).
biography.name: Evamaria Salcher

biography.bio: Arndt Schwering-Sohnrey was born on November 6, 1972. He is an actor and director, known for Inglourious Basterds (2009), A Dangerous Method (2011) and Good Bye Lenin! (2003).
biography.name: Arndt Schwering-Sohnrey

biography.bio: Johannes Klaußner was born on November 28, 1985. He is an actor, known for Old School (2013), The Depraved (2011) and Diplomatie (2014).
biography.name: Johannes Klaußner

biography.bio: Nona Maaß is an actress, known for Das Adlon. Eine Familiensaga (2013).
biography.name: Nona Maaß

biography.placeOfBirth: Lvov, Ukrainian SSR, USSR [now Lviv, Ukraine]
biography.bio: Waléra Kanischtscheff was born on November 2, 1965 in Lvov, Ukrainian SSR, USSR as Waléra. He is known for his work on Deadpool (2016), Avengers: Age of Ultron (2015) and The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo (2011).
biography.name: Waléra Kanischtscheff

biography.bio: Maria Ehrich was born on February 26, 1993 in Erfurt, Germany. She is an actress, known for Vert émeraude (2016), My Brother Is a Dog (2004) and Rouge rubis (2013).
biography.name: Maria Ehrich

biography.bio: Thomas Thieme was born on October 29, 1948 in Weimar, Thuringia, Germany. He is an actor, known for The Lives of Others (2006), Downfall (2004) and The Baader Meinhof Complex (2008).
biography.name: Thomas Thieme

biography.bio: Kai-Peter Malina was born on October 29, 1989. He is an actor, known for The White Ribbon (2009), Lore (2012) and Homegame (2009).
biography.name: Kai-Peter Malina

biography.bio: Mathilde Bundschuh was born on July 30, 1994 in Plauen, Saxony, Germany. She is an actress, known for Sara (2008), A Family of Three (2011) and Geliebtes Kind (2012).
biography.name: Mathilde Bundschuh

biography.bio: Alexander Pensel is an actor, known for Die Klasse - Berlin 61 (2015), Bukow and König (1971) and SOKO Leipzig (2001).
biography.name: Alexander Pensel

biography.bio: Alexander Becht was born on January 8, 1986. He is an actor, known for Rote Rosen (2006), Gute Zeiten, schlechte Zeiten (1992) and The Bridge (2008).
biography.name: Alexander Becht

biography.bio: Thomas Schendel was born in 1956 in Düsseldorf, Germany. He is an actor, known for Lammbock (2001), Love in Thoughts (2004) and Dead (2013).
biography.name: Thomas Schendel

biography.bio: Michael Schenk was born on December 21, 1965 in Osnabrück, Germany. He is an actor and writer, known for Bridge of Spies (2015), The White Ribbon (2009) and The Reader (2008).
biography.name: Michael Schenk
